slashCommands.name: commit
slashCommands.description:
Task: Based on the provided git diff, generate a title and optional description. Ensure that it includes a precise and informative subject line that succinctly summarizes the crux of the changes. If the provided git diff is complex, follow with an explanatory body. This explanatory body will provide insight into the nature of the changes, the reasoning behind them, and any significant consequences or considerations arising from them. Constraints: You should strictly output the commit message without any additional information or comments. The output should only contain the commit message itself.
Guidelines:
- Succinctly summarizes the crux of the changes
- Title should be a single line and under 40 characters long.
- Focus on the changes as a whole instead of independant changes.
- Limit the line length to 80 characters.
- Use the body of the commit message to provide more detailed information if necessary

slashCommands.name: comment
slashCommands.description: Write well-formatted comments for the given code, including both multi-line and single-line comments

slashCommands.name: share
slashCommands.description: Export the current chat session to markdown

customCommands.name: Explain
customCommands.prompt:
{{{ input }}}

 Explain the following code snippet:
customCommands.description: Anaylize the given code snippet and explain what it's trying to acheive and how

customCommands.name: unit tests
customCommands.prompt:
{{{ input }}}

Write a comprehensive set of unit tests for the selected code. It should setup, run tests that check for correctness including important edge cases, and teardown. Ensure that the tests are complete and sophisticated. Give the tests just as chat output, don't edit any file.
customCommands.description: Write unit tests for highlighted code

customCommands.name: check for bugs
customCommands.description: Check for mistakes in my code
customCommands.prompt:
{{{ input }}}

Please read the highlighted code and check for any mistakes. You should look for the following, and be extremely vigilant:
- Syntax errors
- Logic errors
- Security vulnerabilities
- Performance issues
- Anything else that looks wrong

Once you find an error, please explain it as clearly as possible, but without using extra words. For example, instead of saying 'I think there is a syntax error on line 5', you should say 'Syntax error on line 5'. Give your answer as one bullet point per mistake found.

customCommands.name: improveperformance
customCommands.prompt:
{{{ input }}}

Please review the highlighted code and suggest ways to improve its performance. You should focus on improving time complexity, space complexity or both.

customCommands.name: formattedDocstrings
customCommands.prompt:
{{{ input }}}

Please write a docstrings for each function, method and class in the highlighted code. The docstring should follow pep-287 which defines the google docstring format markdown formatting

quickActions.title: Unit test
quickActions.prompt: Write a unit test for this code. Do not change anything about the code itself.

quickActions.title: Docstring
quickActions.prompt: Write a docstrings for this code. The docstring should follow pep-287 which defines the google docstring markdown format . Do not change anything about the code itself.

quickActions.title: Comment
quickActions.prompt: Write well-formatted comments for the given code, including both multi-line and single-line comments

quickActions.title: Bug Check
quickActions.prompt:
Check and fix this code for any mistakes. You should check/fix the following, and be extremely vigilant:
- Syntax errors
- Logic errors
- Security vulnerabilities
- Performance issues
- Anything else that looks wrong

quickActions.title: Type Hints
quickActions.prompt: Add type hints to this code without changing the core functionality
